snippet: Students in the United States scored in the middle of the developed world in reading and science, but lower in math, according to results released on Tuesday.
abstract: Results of the Program for International Student Assessment show that 15-year-olds in the United States scored in the middle of the developed world in reading and science while lagging in math; results are similar to those in previous year.
lead_paragraph: Students in the United States scored in the middle of the developed world in reading and science, but lower in math, according to results released on Tuesday.

headline.main: American 15-Year-Olds Lag, Mainly in Math, on International Standardized Tests
headline.print_headline: American 15-Year-Olds Lag, Mainly in Math, on International Standardized Tests

keywords.value: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development
keywords.name: organizations
